BR_text.BRsummary: Tag "DET" missing from the Portuguese tagmap
BR_text.BRdescription:
The tag "DET" is missing from the Portuguese tagmap and is mapped to "X" rather than "DET" (the word "no" in the following example).
 <denchmark-code>>>> import spacy
 >>> nlp = spacy.load('pt_core_news_sm')
 >>> doc = nlp('em Damão e Diu e no estado de Goa')
 >>> for token in doc:
 	print(token.text, token.tag_, token.pos_)
 
 em PRP|@ADVL> ADP
 Damão <first-cjt>|PROP|M|S|@P< PROPN
 e <co-prparg>|KC|@CO CCONJ
 Diu PROP|M|S|@P< PROPN
 e <co-prparg>|KC|@CO CCONJ
 no DET X
 estado <cjt>|<prop>|<np-def>|N|M|S|@P< NOUN
 de PRP|@N< ADP
 Goa PROP|M|S|@P< PROPN
 </denchmark-code>
 
 
 Operating System: Windows10 x64
 Python Version Used: 3.7.5 x64
 spaCy Version Used: 2.2.2

comments_0.comment_text:
I'm not quite sure how the Portuguese tag set / tag map ended up in such an ... interesting state, but there are quite a few tags missing:
 <denchmark-code>ADJ
 AUX
 CCONJ
 DET
 INTJ
 NUM
 PART
 PRON
 PUNCT
 SCONJ
 SYM
 VERB
 X
 adv
 </denchmark-code>
 
 There are also 88 entries that aren't used by the current model, but that's less of a problem.
